newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysian city rejects outdoor Jackson concert.
newsitem.headline: Malaysian city rejects outdoor Jackson concert.

text.p: A Malaysian municipal council on Monday rejected an application to stage a show featuring pop king Michael Jackson, saying it could not be sure the U.S. entertainer would abide by its rules of propriety.
The national Bernama news agency said the Shah Alam Municipal Council rejected the application by organisers to hold the outdoor concert at the Shah Alam stadium on October 27.

Bernama quoted council president Aini Taib as saying the proposed concert was rejected after taking into account several factors, including its affect on young people in the predominantly Moslem nation.
Aini said applications for such shows must satisfy many conditions, including the attire of the artists, and the council could not be certain Jackson would abide by the conditions.
He said the concert promoter could appeal.
Jackson staged a concert in Moslem Brunei in July for Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah's 50th birthday, at which his trademark crotch-grabbing gestures were noticeably absent.
The Malaysian stop was to be part of Jackson's "HISstory" world tour. Tickets were priced between 160 and 350 ringgit ($64 and $140).
